Alexandre, thank you for bringing up reaction-diffusion systems.  You
make =
a good point- my statement was too broad, in part because
"cellular growth =
model" is a fairly ambiguous term that can
potentially refer to many types =
of systems.  

Just to clarify my statement, I was responding the line of d=
iscussion
with Peter about encodings that actually create distinct bodily s=
hapes
that are self-contained and have clear structural boundaries (which
r=
eaction-diffusion systems tend not to produce; rather they produce
wallpape=
r-like patterns).  Often when growth-based models are used to
define actual=
 bodies with distinct borders, they are studied in the
context of blobs wit=
h a particular focus on how the blob knows when to
stop growing so that a b=
order shape can be created.  That kind of
systems goes along with the "skin=
" issue that we were discussing.

Nevertheless, the field is quite broad an=
d there are many possible
interesting examples of such systems.  If I could=
 revisit my
statement, I would reword it such as to avoid implying any swee=
ping
generalization.

ken
